documents.text: ###As an app user, I want to receive an introduction to how it works the first time I launch the app (app motivation).###An introduction to how the app works is displayed the first time the app is launched.+++The introduction to how the app works is not displayed when the app is launched subsequently.+++The explanatory content is available to app users in the respective functional areas.+++

###As an app user, I want to be notified about the terms of use and privacy provisions the first time I launch the app (data privacy screen) and grant my consent, so that I know how my data will be used within the app.###By using the app, the user accepts the terms of use and privacy provisions.+++The terms of use can be displayed within the app.+++The consent prompt is shown only the first time a user launches the app.+++

###As an app user, I want to be asked whether I consent to the creation of pseudonymized IDs and sending them to devices near me the first time I use the app, so that I am informed about how the app works.### Confirmation of the creation of pseudonymized IDs and their transmission to nearby devices by the app is a prerequisite for using the app.+++ The prompt no longer appears after the first time the app is used.+++

###As an app user, I want to be asked whether the application is allowed to send me notifications the first time I use the app, so that I can get notifications in a variety of situations.###The app's notification settings are queried before the app is used for the first time. +++ This enables local notifications. True push notifications from external servers are not supported (APNs/FCM). +++ The prompt no longer appears after the first time the app is used.+++

###As an app user, I want the app to be displayed in my language the first time I use it, so that I can understand how to use the app.### The configured system language is detected.+++ If the content is not available in the detected system language, English is selected by default.+++The first version of the app is expected to be available also in languages other than English.+++

###As an app user, I want to see help functions and settings for accessibility during the onboarding process, so that I can use the app.### Accessibility is provided depending on the options available in the respective operating system.+++

###As an app user, I want to have access to a FAQ list, so that I can find answers to questions I might have about the app.### The app will either contain a link to a web page with FAQs, which is displayed in a browser window, or the web page will be displayed within the app itself.+++
###As an app user, I want to have access to instructions, so that I can understand the app and its functions.### An explanation of the app's various functions will be provided.+++
###As an app user, I want to have access to an explanatory video, so that I can understand how to use the app and its functions.### An explanation of the app's various functions will be provided.+++

###As an app user, I want to be able to display publication information for the app, so that I can see who is responsible for development and content of the app.### There is a Publication information item in the menu.+++ The publication information contains the usual information required.+++
###As an app user, I want to be able to display the terms of use and data privacy information at any time.### The app provides simple access to the terms of use and data privacy information.+++

###As an app user, I want to be able to see various hotlines for technical, privacy-related, health-related, and psychological questions, as well as for verification of test results, so that I can receive further information or answers to my questions.### The app offers access to a technical hotline and a hotline for obtaining a phone TAN.+++ The times the hotline is available (such as 24/7) is displayed.+++ Phone numbers can be called directly from the app.+++

###As an app user, I want to be able to activate and deactivate the app, so that I can switch the functions on and off.### The functions for generating pseudonymized IDs and sending them to nearby devices can be activated and deactivated. +++ The consequences of activation/deactivation are explained.+++

###As an app user, I want to be able to reset to the app to the delivery defaults, so that I can reconfigure it.###The app can be reset to the delivery defaults with a setting option. +++The saved traces have to be deleted through the system settings.+++

###As an app user, I want to be able to adjust the app settings (access permissions, such as notifications) in a menu, so that I can manage the app functions and accesses.### App users can call a menu for app settings. +++ Notifications can be activated and deactivated.+++ Access to the functions for generating pseudonymized IDs and sending them to nearby devices can be activated and deactivated.+++ Before access permissions are deactivated, I receive information as to which app functions will no longer work (in full).+++

###As an app user, I want to be notified when a person I have had contact with has reported an infection, so that I can then take the appropriate measures to stop the spread of the virus.### Depending on the notification settings, the app sends a notification to the user.+++ If the risk assessment for a user changes, a notification informs users that there is news in the app. The actual changed risk assessment is not displayed until the app is opened.+++

###As an app user, I want to receive instructions from the app if I am exposed to the virus, so that I can adapt my behavior to RKI recommendations.### A notification leads the user to the app. The recommendations from the RKI are defined statically in the app.+++

###As the RKI, I want only positively tested users to trigger a one-time warning, so that I can prevent misuse.### Only positive tests can trigger a warning. This is ensured by the verification server and the hotline for the phone TAN procedure.+++ A warning can only be triggered once for each test.+++

###As an app user, I want to receive information about the illness and the necessary next steps in case of a positive test result, so that I can adapt my behavior to RKI recommendations.### A notification merely informs you that there is news in the app. The test result itself can only be seen in the app. +++ An info text with defined content is displayed in the app (for example, information about the outcome of the test result, information about necessary measures, a hotline number).+++

###As an app user, I want to be able to scan a QR code provided by a medical professional or test center, so that I can receive my test result in the Corona-Warn-App.### A QR code provided on a flyer from the medical professional or test center can be scanned with the Corona-Warn-App.+++ An explanatory text is displayed.+++

###As an app user, I want to be notified within the Corona-Warn-App as soon as a test result becomes available.### A notification merely informs you that there is news in the app. The test result itself can only be seen in the app.+++ The notification does not explicitly indicate whether the result is positive or negative.+++

###As an app user, I want to be able to grant my consent to sending the pseudonymized IDs under which I was visible to other people in recent days to the Warn server if I receive a positive test result, so that the people I have been in contact with can be warned by their apps.### The IDs can be sent to the Warn server pseudonymized.+++ Data transmission is only possible if successfully verified beforehand. This is ensured by the verification server and the hotline for the phone TAN procedure.+++ Data transmission is only possible if the app user has granted consent beforehand.+++

###As an app user, I want to be able to use a manual process (in addition to the digital process), for example, through a call center and without a QR code, to send the pseudonymized IDs under which I was visible to other app users in recent days, to the Warn server, so that the people I have been in contact with can be warned by their apps.### The center responsible can generate a TAN and provide it to the person. (The TAN is generated by a server, not the call center itself.)+++

###As an app user, I want to be able to enter a TAN in the app, so that I can use the TAN I have been given to assign my test result to my instance of the app.### It is possible to enter a TAN within the app.+++ The app verifies the entered TAN and provides feedback as to whether it was correct (must be checked whether technically possible).+++

###As an app user, I want to share my pseudonymized IDs voluntarily after the TAN is verified, so that I can warn persons I may have been in contact with.### The IDs can be sent to the Warn server pseudonymized.+++ Data transmission is only possible if successfully verified beforehand. This is ensured by the verification server and the hotline for the phone TAN procedure.+++ Data transmission is only possible if the person has granted consent beforehand.+++

###As the RKI, I want to be able to configure the parameters (to the extent the API is able to do this) for risk scoring, so that I can keep up with the latest research findings on virus transmission.### Thresholds can be configured dependent on the provided API.+++ The app receives dynamic configurations from the RKI that can affect how the risk assessment is calculated.+++
###As an app user, I want to be able to contact a hotline, so that I can resolve any technical problems with the app.### The phone number of the technical hotline is available in the app.+++

###As an app user, I want it to have audio output, so that I can use the app even if I have impaired vision (or am blind), for example.### Accessibility regarding audio output is provided depending on the options available in the respective operating system.+++

###As an app user, I want to have good contrast settings, modifiable font sizes, and an easily readable font, so that I can read the texts in the app easily.### Accessibility regarding contrast and font size/type is provided depending on the options available in the respective operating system.+++

###As an app user, I want to have the content in simplified language, so that I can easily understand how to use the app and why I should use it.### The texts and languages are defined by the ordering party.+++

###As the RKI, I want to manage the app content centrally, so that I can update texts, links, hotlines, and so on once for all the places in the app. ### Content management will be carried out based on RKI requirements. +++ Content will be differentiated by static and dynamic content, in line with technical feasibility.+++ In the initial version, updates will be performed through an app update. +++
